cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 445 miles SE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest then north-northwest, cross western Cuba, and track northward toward the west-central Florida coast (near Tampa Bay) by mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast between Fort Myers and Tampa Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for Florida as of Advisory 7
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for Florida as of Advisory 7
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida peninsula and Keys, especially the west-central coast from Naples northward through Tampa Bay and the Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (gale to strong tropical storm) are possible as early as Tuesday night, with hurricane-force winds possible near landfall Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential life-threatening storm surge of 3–5 ft or higher in and around Tampa Bay if the storm tracks near the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents, and possible port‐side power outages.
